Triflic acid }} }} 'Fluoroboric acid' or 'fluoboric acid' (systematically named 'oxonium tetrafluoroboranuide' or 'oxonium tetrafluoridoborate(1-)') is an inorganic compound with the chemical formula . As fluoroboric acid has not been isolated, its descriptive properties remain largely unknown. It is mainly produced as a precursor to other fluoroborate salts. It is classified as a strong acid, fluoroboric acid is corrosive and attacks the skin. It is available commercially as a solution in water and other solvents such as diethyl ether. With a strength comparable to nitric acid, fluoroboric acid is a strong acid with a weakly coordinating, non-oxidizing conjugate base.
wiki.title: fluoroboric acid
